title: Home Page
content: Welcome to my Digital Garden! This is a collection of highlights of anything interesting I come across and notes about my life, projects, etc. Why JSBox? JSBox is intended to be a "JavaScript Box" as I mostly do projects in JS. [!info] Use the Search Bar, the sidebar or the links below to navigate. Here are some of my past projects: AnimHelper Card Game Scheme Check out my recent posts: Notes on Cobalt: (9:11 PM - April 16, 2025) The Boss Gave Up: (9:06 PM - April 16, 2025) My feelings on Vegas Pro: (5:17 PM - March 07, 2025) Useful Git Commands: (2:48 PM - March 05, 2025) My Toolbox: (1:12 PM - March 05, 2025)

title: AnimHelper
content: AnimHelper is a PowerPoint tool I made for faster animation. I used it to create the first version of my Card Game. Sure, it's not the best of my projects, but it did it's job. Functions: Self-Animate: Select an object to assign it an animation and set the trigger to itself. Animate with a Trigger: Select an object, and then a trigger. The animation will be assigned to your first object with the second one as the trigger. Self-Animate Multiple: Each selected object will be assigned an animation with the trigger set to itself. Animate Multiple with a Trigger: Select multiple objects, and then a trigger. The animation will be assigned to all of your selected objects with the last one as the trigger. GitHub Repository Home

title: Card Game Scheme
content: Scheme of an educational card game. It was originally created in PowerPoint, but it can be used for any workflow. "Answer File" and "Question File" could be a single SQLite DB, as I did in later projects. Released Build Home

title: My feelings on Vegas Pro
content: I've used DaVinci Resolve for some time, but I had a few painful issues with it: It often crashed and/or crashed the GPU driver, often requiring a reboot. It failed to detect my sound devices. Rendering was slow. Vegas Pro 19, surprisingly for some, has none of these issues, and comes along with bonuses such as: Easy-to-use interface Sound Forge integration GPU Rendering[1] Actually usable Pan/Crop and Plugin Chains (seriously, this is WAY better than the node system) And best of all, it has sales frequently! So I included it in My Toolbox. Home Free DaVinci Resolve lacks GPU rendering: DaVinci Resolve 19 Supported Codec List Vegas supports Intel QSV on my config. ↩︎

title: Notes on Cobalt
content: A lot of programs are really fussy when it comes to cobalt.tools and videos downloaded with it. Use Remux or any converter. In Settings, set the filename style to Basic for better readability. Settings only work for YT videos (tested with 小红书). Home

title: The Boss Gave Up
content: So the boss just casually let me end the stage. (He's in the background...) Like, what? Home

title: Useful Git Commands
content: Setup: git config --global user.name username git config --global user.email email Init Repo: git init git add . git remote add origin remote-url <link> git commit -m "any_message" git push --set-upstream origin master Commit & Push: git commit -m "any_message" git push Home
